body.para: Import records from a database or text file.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The name of the source file from which to add records, including an optional drive, directory, and extension. See SetDefault() and SetPath() for file searching and creation rules. The default extension for database files is determined by the RDD (see the "RDD Specifics" appendix in the

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: for details on a particular RDD). For text files, it is .TXT.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: > in shared mode. If the file does not exist, a runtime error is raised. If the file is successfully opened, the operation proceeds. If access is denied because, for example, another process has exclusive use of the file, NetErr() is set to TRUE. Refer to the "Concurrency Control" chapter in the

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: for more information on resolving concurrency conflicts.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The list of fields to append from <

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Only fields with the same names and types in both files are appended. If fields with the same name do not match in data type, a runtime error is raised.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The portion of the current database file to process. The default is all visible records in <

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A condition that each visible record within the scope must meet, starting with the current record. As soon as the while condition fails, the process terminates.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A condition that each visible record within the scope must meet in order to be processed. If a record does not meet the specified condition, it is ignored and the next visible record is processed.
A System Data Format file with format specifications as shown in the table below. Records and fields are fixed length.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Padded with leading blanks or zeros

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A text file in which character fields are enclosed in double quote marks (the default delimiter) or the specified <

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: >. Fields and records are variable length, and the format specifications are shown in the table below:

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Can be delimited, with trailing blanks truncated

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Delimiters are not required and APPEND FROM correctly handles character fields not enclosed with them.
A text file in which fields are separated by one space and character fields are not enclosed in delimiters. The format specifications are shown in the table below:

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: Not delimited, trailing blanks can be truncated

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: If the DELIMITED WITH clause is specified on an APPEND FROM command line, it must be the last clause specified.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: The name of the RDD that will service the work area. If not specified, the default RDD as determined by RDDSetDefault() is used.

text.style: font-family:Arial; font-size:10pt; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; text-decoration:none; text-transform:none; vertical-align:baseline; color:#000000; background-color:transparent; letter-spacing:normal; letter-scaling:100%;

para.text: A one-dimensional array with the names of RDDs from which the main RDD inherits special functionality. This allows you to use RDDs with special capabilities, like encryption or decryption, in different work areas with different database drivers. These RDDs overlay special functions of the main RDD (specified with the VIA clause). If multiple RDDs (specified with this INHERIT FROM clause) implement the same function, the function associated with the last RDD in the list takes precedence.

body.para: Deleted records: If SetDeleted() is FALSE, deleted records in <xcSourceFile> are appended to the current database file and retain their deleted status. If SetDeleted() is TRUE, however, deleted records are not visible and are, therefore, not processed.

Unmatched field widths: If a field in the current database file is character type and has a field length greater than the incoming <xcSourceFile> data, APPEND FROM pads the source data with blanks. If the current field is character data type and its field length is less than the incoming source data, the source data is truncated to fit. If the current field is numeric type and the incoming source data has more digits than the current field length, a runtime error is raised.
This example demonstrates an APPEND FROM command using a fields list and a condition:

text.style: font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#0000ff;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#0000ff;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#ff0000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#0000ff;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#0000ff;

body.para: The next example demonstrates how a <Scope> can be specified to import a particular record from another database file:

font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#0000ff;
font-weight:bold; font-style:normal; color:#000000;
